A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I liked the characters. I loved the actors' performances. I even thought what they did with Luke's story arc was interestingly fresh (however saddening it was to see). What I did not like however\, was how jarringly full of stupid this movie was. The plot is essentially moved forward by a string of moments of someone doing something that makes no sense\, neither to rational thought nor to the Star Wars lore\, and the audience is left to cringe in horror. 

Otherwise great acting performances and beautiful special effects are mostly deflated by a lack of narrative substance\, and by groan-inducing idealistic 'messages' which seem shoe-horned in at odd times during the film (why can't we just be told a good story\, and not be lectured?). Rey's obvious Mary Sue treatment does not excite things either.

All the buildings blocks for an excellent film are there: A wonderfully acted female protagonist\, classic fan favourites Luke Skywalker and Leia Organa\, a positively unconventional bad guy\, endearing side characters\, and a budget worthy of only Disney itself\, and yet\, this movie refuses to do anything with it\, apart from a bit of CGI eye candy.

In other words\, exactly what you would expect from a modern cinema experience\, so if you're into that you'll be grandly entertained.
